name: Blue 42
text: With Blue 42, my team and I wanted to create a beginner-friendly fantasy football experience. Rather than focusing on the NFL teams, we decided to have our league centered around college football.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, Node, Express, MySQL, Sequelize, Handlebars, Materialize, Git

name: Spontaneous Selection
text: Spontaneous Selection is the perfect app for a date night with no plans. Rather than trying to figure out where you want to eat and go, our app will give you a random resturant/bar and event in your city.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, Materialize, JQuery, 3rd Party APIs, Git

name: Budget Tracker
text: Built as a PWA, Budget Tracker is your one stop app for planning a budget. Not only is it a responve app, but it also works in offline mode! Any changes made will be sent to the server once the app is online.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, MongoDB, IndexedDB, Node, Express, Git

name: Password Generator
text: With Blue 42, my team and I wanted to create a beginner-friendly fantasy football experience. Rather than focusing on the NFL teams, we decided to have our league centered around college football.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, MySQL, Sequelize, Handlebars, Materialize, Git

name: Work Day Scheduler
text: Aimed at the busy employee, Work Day Scheduler seeks to help you maintain your busy schedule in 1-hour block segments. You can add notes, meetings, etc. to keep yourself on track.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Moment.js, Local Storage, Git

name: Note Taker
text: A handy app for making notes on the fly, Note Taker allows you to type, save, and delete notes at a moments notice. Responsive design adds a nice feature that notes can only be saved once typed out.
tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Node.js, Express.js, Git
